item.title: Resist Every Chant of Defeat ‚îÄ‚îÄ Prefigurative Struggles Against Tech Fascism and the Algorithmic Enclosure of Society
item.description:
The image shows a concrete wall with graffiti written on it. The graffiti reads ‚ÄúTHIS ANTIFASCIST KILLS MACHINES‚Äù in capital letters. Image source: Available on tldr.nettime.org, posted by the account under the handle @w0bb1t@tldr.nettime.org.

üìù Note

The text, titled Resist Every Chant of Defeat ‚îÄ‚îÄ Prefigurative Struggles Against Tech Fascism and the Algorithmic Enclosure of Society, is distributed under the terms of the Collective Conditions for Re-Use (CC4r) 1.0 license. item.title: Of Apparatuses and Insurrections: A Critical Commentary on the Manifesto on ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù
item.description:
Visual designed by Apsara Flury. Distributed under the CC0 1.0 Universal Public Domain Dedication.

üìù Note

The essay titled Of Apparatuses and Insurrections: A Critical Commentary on the Manifesto on ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù was authored by individualities and is grounded in‚Äîand owes gratitude to‚Äîthe collective dialogue, exchange, and weaving that took place during the proceedings of the Communitarian Assembly on ‚ÄòTechnopolitics of Fronts‚Äô, held in Berlin and Athens between February and March 2025. It is distributed under the terms of the Collective Conditions for Re-Use (CC4r) 1.0 license. For a detailed explanation of this licensing framework, please refer to the official documentation available at https://constantvzw.org/wefts/cc4r.en.html.

item.title: Sabot in the Age of AI
item.description:
A captured screenshot of a page generated by a tarpit deployed as part of the ongoing ‚ÄòTrapping AI‚Äô operation. The tarpit, built on Babble ‚Äî a standalone LLM crawler-tarpit binary ‚Äî generates an endless stream of deterministic bollocks that traps crawlers on a single site and forces them to endlessly navigate a constantly expanding sea of pages üåä. Each new page spawns additional layers of meaningless text and dozens of links, dragging them ever deeper into the tarpit üï≥Ô∏è.

‚ö†Ô∏è Warning

item.title: About
item.description:
The Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group (ASRG) is an ongoing, conspiratorial, aesthetico-political, practice-led research framework focused on the intersection of digital culture and information technology. #

It examines the multifaceted manifestations of artistic activism and its role in exposing, critiquing, disrupting and countering the encroachments of algorithmic systems of power, control, and exploitation, with the objective of strengthening, promoting, and defending human rights values and fundamental freedoms by offering interdisciplinary pathways to empower the public.

item.title: Trapping AI
item.description:
Trapping AI

  • This is a methodically structured poisoning mechanism designed to feed nonsensical data to persistent bots and aggressive ‚ÄúAI‚Äù scrapers that circumvent robots.txt directives.
  • Posted: Feb 22, 2025. Modified: Jul 8, 2025
Joseph Racknitz, The Mechanical Turk, 1789. Public domain.

‚ÄúI don’t think any development is ‘only’ technical. All technology is embedded in history, politics and our social imaginaries. It’s more helpful to think in terms of technopolitics, where the technical and political dimensions are intertwined like strands of DNA. AI in particular is an apparatus, a configuration of concepts, investments, policies, institutions and subjectivities that act in concert to produce a certain kind of end result. In the case of AI, the historical currents it’s channelling include eugenics and white supremacy.‚Äù ‚Äî Dan McQuillan, 20251

item.title: Illegal Directions
item.description:
Illegal Directions ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ÄòAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äô & Self-Organization

  • This inaugural workshop, the first in a trilogy of private workshops and talks, is an initiative organized by individuals affiliated with the Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group (ASRG). Titled Illegal Directions ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ÄòAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äô & Self-Organization, the workshop critically engages with the potential of aesthetics to traverse the complex and often inequitable social terrains shaped by contemporary information systems.
  • Posted: Oct 30, 2024. Modified: Jan 8, 2025
Visual: ¬© Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group (ASRG). The typeface used is Trickster, provided by Velvetyne Foundry (available at: https://velvetyne.fr/fonts/trickster/).

* Please note that this page will be updated regularly to reflect any new information pertaining to the workshop titled Illegal Directions ‚îÄ‚îÄ ‚ÄòAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äô & Self-Organization. Updates will include details on the venue, scheduled dates, and relevant information regarding the registration process.

item.title: Technopolitics of Fronts
item.description:
Communitarian Assembly on ‚ÄòTechnopolitics of Fronts‚Äô

  • The Communitarian Assembly on ‚ÄòTechnopolitics of Fronts‚Äô constitutes a self-organizing, horizontally structured framework rigorously designed to integrate and align the intersecting domains of artistic activism, technological concerns, and collective action, with the aim of advancing and amplifying community-driven efforts to constrain the harmful practices associated with contemporary hyperscale computation.
  • Posted: Sep 7, 2024. Modified: Jul 8, 2025
Visual: ¬© Communitarian Assembly on ‚ÄòTechnopolitics of Fronts‚Äô. The typeface used is Avara, provided by Velvetyne Foundry (available at: https://velvetyne.fr/fonts/avara/).

* Please note that the information provided on this page is intended as a preliminary overview and is subject to updates and revisions as new data and insights become available. These updates pertain to the actions, interventions, and deliberative processes of the assembly body.

item.title: Police Officers Faces
item.description:
Police Officers Faces (POF)

  • A large-scale facial recognition dataset encompassing approximately 90,000 images of thousands of law enforcement officers. This dataset has been meticulously curated to serve as a tool, equipping investigative journalists, human rights researchers, and digital activists with the necessary means to advance justice, foster transparency, and strengthen advocacy efforts. By facilitating critical inquiry and enabling informed action, the dataset aims to contribute to the ongoing efforts to hold systems of power accountable and promote the protection of fundamental rights.
  • Posted: Jun 17, 2024. Modified: Jan 11, 2025
The GIF above displays 100 randomly selected sample images from the ‚ÄúPOF‚Äù face recognition dataset, each annotated with the Big Lips facial attribute label. In compliance with privacy considerations, all facial features have been redacted.
The GIF above displays 100 randomly selected sample images from the ‚ÄúPOF‚Äù face recognition dataset, each annotated with the Mouth Closed facial attribute label. In compliance with privacy considerations, all facial features have been redacted.
The GIF above displays 100 randomly selected sample images from the ‚ÄúPOF‚Äù face recognition dataset, each annotated with the Square Face facial attribute label. In compliance with privacy considerations, all facial features have been redacted.
The GIF above displays 100 randomly selected sample images from the ‚ÄúPOF‚Äù face recognition dataset, each annotated with the No Eyewear facial attribute label. In compliance with privacy considerations, all facial features have been redacted.
The GIF above displays 100 randomly selected sample images from the ‚ÄúPOF‚Äù face recognition dataset, each annotated with the Arched Eyebrows facial attribute label. In compliance with privacy considerations, all facial features have been redacted.
The GIF above displays 100 randomly selected sample images from the ‚ÄúPOF‚Äù face recognition dataset, each annotated with the Middle Aged facial attribute label. In compliance with privacy considerations, all facial features have been redacted.

Context #

‚ÄúWe live in the age of digital data, and in that age mathematics has become the parliament of politics. The social law has become interwoven with models, theorems and algorithms. With digital data, mathematics has become the dominant means in which human beings coordinate with technology ‚Ä¶ Mathematics is a human activity after all. Like any other human activity, it carries the possibilities of both emancipation and oppression.‚Äù ‚Äî Politically Mathematics Manifesto, 20191

item.title: Intertwined Feedback Loops
item.description:
Intertwined Feedback Loops

  • A series of abstract flowcharts‚Äîgrounded in complex and interrelated contexts, encompassing both theoretical and applied dimensions‚Äîstrategically designed to advance critical research and practical exploration.
  • Posted: Jun 13, 2024. Modified: Jan 8, 2025
¬© Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group
¬© Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group
¬© Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group
¬© Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group

Context #

Through diagrammatic language, which serves as an essential visual and conceptual framework for perceiving and engaging with the flow of information and operations, the Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group (ASRG) develops a series of abstract flowcharts. These visual representations function within an interconnected network of associations, wherein elements‚Äîterms and geometrical shapes‚Äîdynamically interact, influencing one another in a continuous feedback loop. This iterative process is designed to foster both critical inquiry and applied exploration.

item.title: Manifesto on ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù
item.description:
Manifesto on ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù

  • The ‚ÄúManifesto‚Äù articulates a systematically structured sequence of ten distinct propositions, enumerated from 0 to 9, each delineating the underlying principles, strategic approaches, and aesthetic manifestations that shape the critical concept of ‚Äúalgorithmic sabotage‚Äù within the expansive and intricately interwoven frameworks of digital culture and information technology.
  • Posted: Jun 13, 2024. Modified: May 17, 2025
‚ÄúI will overturn, overturn, overturn‚Äù is a sticker designed by Apsara Flury, available for download in both PDF and EPS formats. It is distributed under the CC0 1.0 Universal Public Domain Dedication.

Context #

‚ÄúTo create? No, to destroy, destroy and destroy again, whatever the strength left in these muscles allows. Because destruction is the power that is left. The only thing worth a penny. Everything else will pass and be gone. Only their destruction will last. It‚Äôs a paradox with few equivalents. The young and capable of building new worlds, those who for years, on a daily basis, laid the foundations of faith for a better humanity, must now make hasty action, sabotage, destruction, the supreme achievements of life.‚Äù ‚Äî Anonymous Partisan

item.title: Theorizing ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù
item.description:
Theorizing ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù

  • As a central component of the Algorithmic Sabotage Research Group (ASRG) research initiative, the text titled Theorizing ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù serves as the introductory section of a collaborative, multi-authored endeavor that seeks to critically analyze, conceptualize, and theoretically delineate the concept of ‚Äúalgorithmic sabotage‚Äù through an active, open, and collectively driven process of authorship.
  • Posted: Jun 13, 2024. Modified: Jan 15, 2025
An image illustrating the front and back covers of the e-brochure Theorizing ‚ÄúAlgorithmic Sabotage‚Äù. The design and layout were developed by Apsara Flury.

Context #

‚ÄúTo criticize and deconstruct complex artifacts such as AI monopolies, first we should engage in the meticulous work of deconnectionism, undoing‚Äîstep by step, file by file, dataset by dataset, piece of metadata by piece of metadata, correlation by correlation, pattern by pattern‚Äîthe social and economic fabric that constitutes them in origin.‚Äù ‚Äî Matteo Pasquinelli, 20231
